file_content.text: We'll have that droid brain reproduced in no time.
The admiral's ships are pummeling the pirates. There can't be many survivors.
I went to the pirates' hideout. I found this neural chipset for a battle droid. I think Loramarr designed it.
Well, the stamp seems consistent with his work... wait. It's brilliant.
He's solved the traditional limitations of a chipset brain. Hold on a moment, I need to make a call.
Admiral? We've recovered a battle droid neural chipset from the White Maw. It's the advancement we've been waiting for.
From the White Maw? What are they doing with tech like that?
They had it hidden in the last known location of the inventor Loramarr.
Hoarding it.
Loramarr. That would make sense, his robotics always were top-notch.
It's a quad-photonic neural chipset, Admiral. If you put this in a battle droid, it'll think on its feet better than most humans.
Why didn't you say something about this earlier?
You could have briefed me.
Frankly, I wasn't sure the engineering was possible.
We didn't even know it was more than theory. An innovation like this... its value is a different magnitude.
And a reproducible brain like this, far beyond war droids... producing it would be its own industry.
What you're telling me is I just handed you a small fortune.
What's my cut?
I will make certain you are amply rewarded. Fixer--get that chipset off-planet at once.
I live to serve. The Emperor. My people.
For the Empire.
It sounds like I did the right thing coming to you.
Did I do well?
That's an understatement. If Loramarr invented a reproducible quad-photonic brain, our battle droids could be much smarter.
It could change the course of the war.
Don't let me stall you. Get that chipset to the technicians.
Then get on it!
It will be done immediately.
For someone who dropped off the map, Loramarr's work still seems cutting-edge.
Not bad for a recluse.
Completely. We'll get this to the space station at once.
I'll alert the Reclamation Service to the Loramarr area. There's no telling what else might be there.
As for you... I'd take a well-earned vacation. Somewhere warm.
It's all yours.
Thanking you for something on this scale seems trite. But thank you.
I'll get this to the space station at once and then alert the Reclamation Service to the area.
There's no telling what else they might find in there. And you've delivered it to us on a plate.
I'll let you know if the admiral's dragnet catches anything interesting.
If this works, we will write the final chapter on the White Maw.
In conclusion, Admiral, this seems like the most opportune window we'll get. All I need is the go-ahead.
It meets with my approval, Fixer. You may brief the volunteers and commence with the mission. Over and out.
Ah, the operatives. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you since we heard about your success with the Talz.
My lord, just who I was expecting. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you since we heard about your success with the Talz.
Ah, there you are. I'm Fixer 308. We've been planning for your arrival ever since we heard about your success with the Talz.
Ah, the operatives. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you ever since you rid that power station of the Republic.
My lord, welcome. I'm Fixer 308. We've tracked your success since your victory at the power station.
Ah, you've arrived. I'm Fixer 308. We've been planning for your arrival ever since you rid the power station of the Republic.
The operatives. Good to finally meet you. I'm Fixer 308. I've been tracking your activities since your defeat of the Hailstorm Brotherhood.
My lord, we meet at last. I'm Fixer 308. I've been tracking your activities since your defeat of the Hailstorm Brotherhood.
Welcome. I'm Fixer 308. I've been tracking your success since that business with the Hailstorm Brotherhood.
It was no trouble.
Ah, the operatives we were expecting. Good. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you since you came to the planet.
My lord, just who I was expecting. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you since you came to the planet.
There you are. I'm Fixer 308. We've been tracking you since you came to the planet.
What do you have for me?
Tell me your intentions.
We've been hitting the White Maw hard lately, enough so that they've called a meeting of their gangs.
Why don't I find that comforting?
That's disturbing.
We want you to handle something for us. The White Maw has been damaged enough to call a meeting of their gangs.
Had I known that was my audition, I'd have put in more effort.
I feel used.
We have more to worry about. Current intel indicates that the pirates have suffered enough damage to call a meeting.
The loss of a power station was a bigger blow than we thought. Every one of their gangs will be represented.
At this meet will be the leaders of the Bala D'ur, the Hailstorm Brotherhood, the Scourge and all the other gangs in the White Maw.
We intend to get you into that meeting and have you capture or kill everyone present. The hard part is getting there.
Let me guess. They're going to be surrounded by guards.
Sounds risky.
Private armies, practically. And the meeting location is secret, so you'll have to take drastic measures.
Guards and walls have never kept me out before.
Leave that to me.
That part of the plan I trust to you. But there's more.
How do we do that?
The shuttles of the leaders' trusted captains will have the meeting's coordinates programmed into their navicomputers.
What you'll need to do is find a lieutenant with a shuttle, kill him and get his access card to steal his ship.
Once you get access to the shuttle, fly it to their hideout, track down the gang leaders and take them out. Can you do that?
Sounds like the place will be swarming with White Maw... at least until I get there.
I like a challenge.
All things are possible through the Force.
My limits are few.
Considering these pirates will all be in the same room, I'll charge my group rate.
No problem.
Good. Here's a dossier on the leaders you'll be terminating.
Shall I do this with or without a blindfold?
Clear and easy.
I can do it.
Here's a dossier on the leaders to terminate, so you'll be able to identify them.
Our psych profiles indicate that, given the opportunity, some of them may surrender. It's up to you.
Lastly, if you find an opportunity to search their files, take it. There's no telling what secrets these malcontents have hidden away.
That seems like a long string of chances, ones I will not be taking.
Are you crazy? [Refuse quest]
I see. Then we'll assign one of our squads before this opportunity disappears. I'll break the news to them shortly.
Not now, the admiral's on the comm.
I hope you will appreciate the effort I put in to keep this quiet.
I get the credit, right?
There was no reason to cut me out. I would have supported you had you mentioned it to me.
Enough. What matters is that if this is indeed what Fixer says, our battle droids could be a generation smarter.
You may have taken all the credit from this, but there's no telling what else they may find in there.
I found this in one of the pirates' hideouts. It's a chipset for a battle droid.
Interesting... it does seem very advanced... wait. This looks like Loramarr's work.
What have you been... scratch that, I don't want to know. I have to make a call.
I went to Loramarr. There was little there of interest besides amazingly hostile droids.
Then I'll get Dorn Base to acquire a strike team for us before notifying the Reclamation Service.
I will scout the area personally to verify your report. And you should probably go offworld before any contradictions arise.
There may not be any, but if I were you, I wouldn't stay on this ice ball any longer than I had to.
